quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.line: ...No, you lied to me Andy. You pretended to be in this office for three months and you were sailing on your boat!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I resent that. I, I never lied to you.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Really? [reading from phone] “Hey David, all is good in Scranton PA.”

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: And all was good in Scranton PA that day.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: “By the way, Oscar says 'hi'”

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oscar says “hi” all the time. He says all kinds of greetings. “Hi” “Hello” “Hola” You're telling me you've never heard Oscar say “hi”?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: But you're calling me a liar.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: By the way, that reminds me, I want to ask you about some of the lies you've been telling lately.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Watch it Andy!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh, here we go, January seventh 2013. [Reading from phone] “Hey Andy, all's well. Been meaning to make it down there but my wife's sick.” Well, which is it?! Is all well or is your wife sick?! BUSTED!

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: My wife?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: This has been a really tough time.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Yeah?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Has it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Erin just dumped me and I can't remember any of the aha moments I had on the boat, and I know it sounds weird to say but I really miss my beard.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Shh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It was like a security blan-

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: -ket

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: Shh. I'm not gonna fire you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You're not?

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That's awesome.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: I wouldn't own the company if it wasn't for you. So...I owe you that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: David, I'll be there for you. These five words I swear to you. When you breathe, I want to be here for you. I'll be there for you. That's a poem by J.B. Jovi. I want you to have it.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: We are even...now. Understand? Got it?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Crystal.

quotes.speaker: David
quotes.line: You are on very- Hey, very thin ice.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Vanilla. [David looks confused] Vanilla Ice. It was a band.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: And how are you on this fine- [chokes up, runs into office and slams door pulling the blinds closed]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Crying] Ok, we ready? [cut] Don't use that part. Last week, Erin told me that our relationship would be proceeding without me. Now I have to see her everyday at work. Which is...brutal. When people say office relationships are a good idea, they never talk about what might happen if you break up.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [Moaning from office] Ahhh! Oooooh! ahh

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He sounds like a wounded animal.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Should've put him out of his misery and just fired her.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: I can't be around sad people, it makes me sad.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: I'm the same way with horny people.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ok. [Andy continues moaning]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yes. Pete and I have started seeing each other and Andy still doesn't know. We thought that keeping it secret was more considerate to him. And hot for us. I mean I saw Pete's butt. It's sick.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [taking paper from Kevin] Oh that's mine! Um, I'll just, I'll get it out of the way for you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Jim set up a job interview for me today in Philly. It's um, with a real estate company, which is a great fit for me because I live in a house and I know what a bathroom is. [laughs] I'm sorry, I am just very nervous because honestly this is all moving a lot faster than I expected. And, and because my resume can fit on a post-it note.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [on phone] No, don't just let her eat the grass, she'll puke it right up. OK, just put out two bowls and see which feed she prefers. I'm sorry to be taking up so much of your precious time, Mose, but she's your aunt too. Fine. I'll see what I can do.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: [Jumps out from behind vending machine] I need you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ahh! Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And you should take breaks more often, I've been waiting there for 45 minutes.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What? What is it?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's my aunt Shirley, she's on her last legs.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight, that's awful.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You have no idea. I mean her hair, clothes, it's all falling off in great big clumps. And we need someone to go out there and clean her up. We had a nurse, but she quit because she was “poisoned” by Aunt Shirley.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: What do you mean by “poisoned”?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Probably nothing, or strychnine. Or lemonade and strychnine. Which is actually what it was.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ok, well I'm very sorry about your aunt.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: But I don't see how this is my problem.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Angela. You owe me one, remember? Now please, she's an old woman Angela. She needs a woman's touch. It's all hanging out-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And there's parts of her I don't even recognize.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Gah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: There's this one hanging part in particular, that's some sort of flap.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It's fine.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's like a prehensile wing or something, you know?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ugh! God, I can't. OK, I'll-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's a divet...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I'll help you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: ..where it was and it needs, it needs a...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Where are you going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Uh, not on a three month boat trip.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Wha? Oh, burn. [laughs, Angela and Dwight move to leave.] Uh, excuse me. What, everyone can just leave whenever they want now?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: How dare you?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm still the boss!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: The answer is yes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: ..just have some messages for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Are they from you?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well no, they're from clients.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well then, I don't want them. You can keep 'em. In fact, you can keep that big blue Nautica sweater, I know how much you love it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I can't. I-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Nope, I insist upon it. It's an awesome sweater. Some great memories tied up in that thing.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: These are messages from clients who want to buy paper.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I don't want to talk about work right now.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well I only want to talk about work right now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Then I want my big blue sweater back.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well, I gave it to the Salvation Army.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I've got the seat adjusted right.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Perfect height, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: She got rid of it. My blue sweater. What is that about?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I was just leaving.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Stay! We are in the bro-zone layer. Ok? Nard dog, Plop and Clarker Posey, AKA Clarkwork Orange. Here's the sitch: Erin dumped me, natch. But she got rid of my blue sweater, which was her favorite. Is she moving on a little fast, or am I being a total psycho? Plop, you go first.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I don't know. Women do tend to move on quicker than men.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Survey says: ENH! Doesn't make me feel better at all. Zero Clark Thirty, what do you got?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Look at it this way, being a bachelor is not all bad. I mean, you've got your freedom now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Last night I ordered a pizza by myself and I ate it over the sink like a rat.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: There you go, good for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: You just let it all hang out, that's what...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: May not seem like it, but this really helped. So, thank you. [Andy leaves]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: I'll give you a hundred dollars to wear that sweater to work tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Aunt Shirley, Hello! It's me Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Oh, lookie here. It's big city Dwight. Careful you don't get mud on those fancy town shoes, big city Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Hello Aunt Shirley.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Who's this little kitchen witch? She's so tiny like a little kitchen witch.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: This is Angela, and we brought you some new clothes!

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: New clothes? What for? [Aunt Shirley's boob shows]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, God.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You know what? Before you put the new clothes on, Angela's gonna get you cleaned up a little bit.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Yes. How would you like a nice warm bath?

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: How would you like a mean cold slap? [slaps Angela]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Ow!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok, Aunt Shirley, dear, uh, can I get you a nice crisp liter of schnapps?

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: I could do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No. No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yeah, trust me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It keeps her docile. Go to the kitchen, get the largest receptacle you can find.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Step on it!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Why doesn't Erin seem sad? Has she found someone new or something? And if so, why hasn't she told me? Is she trying to spare my feelings? During breakups, the mind goes to some crazy dark places.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Andy, don't. No good can come from snooping.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I'm not snooping, there's just some crud on her screen.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You're clearly snooping.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: That's kinda uncool, man.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Ah, come on.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Andy!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: That's her private property.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Tell us!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Uh, hello! Who's snooping on who now?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: What does that even mean?

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: What's it say?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Put it down.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Everyone please, just-

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: It's not cool.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Put it down

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Andy. That is her private property.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Boo.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: See?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: That's where nosey'll get you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Told you so.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Darryl, Clark, Toby, Kevin, Plop. Take a knee. Alright, you guys are gonna think I'm psycho again. Uh, couldn't shake this feeling that Erin's dating someone so I looked at her phone.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Man, you can't do that stuff. You'll only find pain. When my ex-wife got into my e-mail account, she was devastated.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Too late. I found out she's been texting a guy named Pete. Does anybody know a Pete?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Pete...

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Hmm.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Pete what?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: It just occurred to me that Andy has been calling me Plop for so long, he forgot my real name. Which is Pete.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [whispers] hello!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey! There she is. [Pam laughs] How you doin?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi! Hey, do I look ok?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You look great.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ok

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [pointing to Jim's bluetooth headset] What's that? Is that a-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ok, I know where you're going with this, and this is who I am now. I'm a douche. But look what I can do with my hands. [Pam laughs]

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: Gotta go, VIP just walked through the door.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: How are you, Isaac? You have something in your ear.

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: It's a phone?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes. It is. And thank you so much for setting up this opportunity, I really appreciate it.

quotes.speaker: Isaac
quotes.line: Of course, anything for Team Halpert. You're gonna crush it, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You are gonna crush it. Wow, I missed you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wait, are you saying that into the phone or are you saying that to me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [touches headset] Call you right back. What were you saying?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Ha ha.

quotes.speaker: Athlead Coworker
quotes.line: Hey, Jim! We've got Trent Edwards on the line.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I've gotta go, but you know what? Team Halpert, ok? You're gonna crush it, you're gonna smash it.[Pam laughs] OK, good luck!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Gosh, she drank so much. And so quickly.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: In her prime, Shirles could put away homemade schnapps morning noon and night.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: [coughs and laughs in her sleep]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Now all it takes is half a liter. She's dreaming. Alright, let's get her out to the yard so you can spray her down.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Spray her down?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, it's a lot better than it sounds. There's a private shower area. Very tasteful, very rustic.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Come on in. Have a seat. Uh, thanks for coming in, I just gotta get something off my chest. I just got some really weird news and uh, I'm just gonna come out and say it. I just got off the phone with my doctor, and it turns out I contracted [reading computer screen] shlmydia...from Erin. And it's incurable. Pretty lame huh?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Yeah. [long pause] You were gone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: I knew it!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: For a long time, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You and Erin are fuhhhhhhherraaaaa!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Andy, just so you know, there was no overlap.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No overlap? Great. Good. Wow. This is suddenly so easy. Guess what? You're fired!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah. You. Are. Fired! One of the perks of being boss. I can fire anyone who steals my girlfriend. And wow, that turns out to be you. Yup. Sorry. [singing] So you had a bad day-

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: ..The camera don't lie!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: You're being an idiot get..

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I'm trying..

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Out of my office, turns out you're fired...

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Because you suck.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: You can't fire-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: And you're fired...

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: If you want to talk to me

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: So you had a bad day...

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I'll be in the annex.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Rut ti doh doh...

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Alright? I'll be in the annex.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Rut tit doh doh...

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Toby!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Rut ti doh doo doh

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Toby?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: You can't fire Pete. You understand why, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Oh, Andy, we had this exact same conversation when you wanted to get rid of Nellie. You can't just get rid of people over grudges.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Nellie was a professional grudge. This is a purely personal grudge.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Alright, well look. While I have you here, this is a relationship disclosure form for Pete & Erin.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: They already have a contract? [Reading] “Mutually agree to-” Ah, every phrase is like a dagger in my crotch.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: It's just boiler plating, you don't have to read it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Well, I'm not signing away my rights.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I already signed it. I was just showing you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ok, well we'll see about that. [crumples paper]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Andy, it's not the original. And destroying it will not stop them from dating. Andy. [Andy throws paper at him and leaves, Toby straightens paper out] It's the original.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: ...[singing] talking Chester avenue, talking triplex, talking converting...Is that her? Hey guys! Say something.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Hi, I'm Mark.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hi, Pam, hello.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: I'm the horrible boss around here, but please don't hire Jamie Foxx to kill me. D'Jango! I don't agree with the use of the “N” word in that movie. It's, it's too soon.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm Pam Halpert.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Oh, hi. They call me Marky Mark around here, because here at Simon Realty, we are one funky bunch! Come on you guys, raise the roof when I say that! I- what are you all temps again today? Let's go, Gangnam style. [laughs] He's heard Gangnam style, he knows it. Right? That's cause he's American. This is Carl. Uh, he's from here. Our neck of the woods. But Gangnam style is great, isn't it?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh my god. He's Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Time to get clean!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: It's hosing time Aunt Shirley, have a seat. You're gonna have a hard time hearing her over the roar of the hose.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You have to use chains?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: You'll see. Here we go.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Let's get this show on the road.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Let's do it! Ready? Here's a box cutter to get her clothes off.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Let's get to it.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No! No!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Give it a whirl.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Dwight, I am not gonna hose your aunt down like some animal.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Stop your belly-aching and hose me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I need you to hose my aunt.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: OK you are useless.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Give me the hose!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No Dwight, I won't- [hoses Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ahh! OK!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: [grunting] I'm gonna give your aunt a proper bath and a haircut like a lady! And you two are gonna shut up about it! Do you have a bathtub?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Yes ma'am.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Good.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: This is not an office so much as it is a uh, rec room with a bunch of computers in it. Frankly, if I had my way, I'd toss the computers in the gar-bage. But unfortunately we use them for practically everything we do. So. That ain't gonna happen. He's a temp, don't worry about him. Alice! Alright, stay awake ok?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hey Nellie. Mmm. I am so sick of February. It's the shortest month but it sure doesn't feel that way. We should catch up.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Um.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Y'know I've been going over my notes from the trial...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Oh no.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: ...feel like I may have glossed over a few...

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: No no no no.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: ...minor points.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: No. Toby, you cannot keep blathering on about this Scranton Strangler. Do something about it. Get it out of your system, whatever it takes.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I've been drafting a letter.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: For two years! Then what? Another year picking out a stamp? Another six months before you decide to lick it? Just- I don't want to hear it!

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: My aunt Joan. Oh, uh well, she uh, she worked here before I did, so there's no nepotism involved. In fact, to be honest with you I'm probably a little harder on her than I am on the rest of these people. Ah, cute. Not work on this...work on this months. Ok Nana? Uh, when I say “Chillax” people chillax. Watch this. Hey Roger, chillax! Must not have heard me.

quotes.speaker: Roger
quotes.line: No. I heard you.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Step this way for The Spanish Inquisition! [laughs] Kids in the Hall. Just, it's not high pressure. Just a little Coffee Talk. Ok? Like butta. Come on in here. Mike Myers.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [Mouths] Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thank you! Thanks, thanks a lot. Really appreciate it. You guys are supposed to have my back. OK? Instead you let a guy named Plop steal my girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Hey boss, I did everything I could. I invited Pete out for drinks, I emailed him shots of my junk....

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Ugh.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Kid doesn't have a romantic bone in his body.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Come on Andy, they're a good match.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: That doesn't matter. Ok? What matters is that I am hurt! Deep hurt inside of me. I don't care if they're Romeo and freaking Juliet! I feel like the guy that Juliet dated before Romeo. Probably her boss. And guess what? Juliet's boss also had feelings.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Hey, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: What?!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: You've got a booger bubble going on there.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [wipes nose] Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: It's ok.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: My whole life is a booger bubble!

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: This is a tiny resume. Papa Smurf! Come back to the mushroom. [Pam laughs] From The Smurfs movie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, I've seen that with my kids. Um, it is tiny, but I've actually been commissioned by the City of Scranton to paint a mural-

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: What does this say here? To ti te per tat... what language is this? Swahili? Oh wait a second, now I can read it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, cause it was upside down. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: You're a good audience. [Pam laughs]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So um-

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Unlike some of these people around here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yeah, the um, the city commissioned me to do the-

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Yeah, we don't have a lot of call for doodling around here. But I like this resume and here's why. It shows that you stick around. Yeah. You don't jump ship easily. Like a lot of these people. I mean they worship me you know? But do they like me? I mean...you think they like me, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: [gets guitar] What if Bob Dylan was your boss? I'm gonna do Dylan! [playing guitar and imitating Bob Dylan] Pam Halpert is my name, and I've been at Dunder Mifflin for seven years? Eight years? Eight years, man. Got the Dunder Mifflin blues. Got the Pam Halpert blues. Got the pra- went to the Pratt Institute...You have children?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Two children, yes.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: You wrote Art and Painting, kinda the same thing. Kinda the same thing. Sometimes I repeat myself, but that's just being Pam. Well I'm kinda cute and I'm- but I'm married so...leave that be.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Hey. You got a sec to talk?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Kinda painful to chat with you Pete. Ever since the old one-two punch to my scrotum pole. Translation: penis. Translation? My manhood.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Yeah. Look, uh I understand breakups are tough. You know, it happens to all of us at some point in life. But you've gotta move on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Great advice. Thank you, you can leave now.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Listen to him, Andy. He's trying to tell you something that you really need to hear.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Awesome perspective. Thanks for butting in.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Well, I've been where you are now. I dated this girl Alice and it was an ugly breakup. She worked at a marketing agency right next to my house. I'd run into her every day but I had to grow up and deal with it, and I did. We're even Facebook friends now.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: See? We can all be friends!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Just, get over it. It doesn't have to be awkward.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I do think we can have a fair....

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Yeah, so life gives you lemons and you've just gotta eat them, rinds and all. And if you don't want to eat them? Your ex-girlfriend will shove them down your throat with the help of her hunky new boyfriend. So that's fun.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Nothing to see here! Boss at work. This will be your desk. Right up front. Best seat on the roller coaster, you must be this tall to ride this ride. No pregnant women allowed. Are you? Uh, yeah I don't- not allowed to ask. So...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I am not pr-

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: You're not.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Pregnant, no.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: I didn't ask her if she was pregnant. She just offered it. The last three girls here all got pregnant.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Don't be afraid, it's a different chair. I don't want a guy up here. I want to you know, see a woman come in and do a great job. Something that, I have to look out this window, I want someone-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I'm sorry I thought this job was for the position of office manager.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: It is. Yeah, you would uh manage this office. Answer the phones and forward the calls and uh you know, go for a coffee run now and again.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So, kinda like a receptionist.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Yeah, like a receptionist, but we call you the office manager because uh, it's less demeaning. By the way, how long are these uh, cameras gonna be following you around? Because I think this is pretty cool. Pretty pretty cool. Larry David, Curb Your Enthusiasm. Do you like that show?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.line: Well, I think they indulge themselves a little too much. I like scripted.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I spent 10 years as a receptionist, to Michael Scott. And I have kids now. And I just, I can't.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Ow! The braid is too tight.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh hush. Loose braids reflect a loose character. Now stay still.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Yes ma'am.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I think your hair is much too long for your age, by the way.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: There.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: Thank you Angela.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: I'm going to the prison. This afternoon. I'm gonna talk to the strangler.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: Probably best to use his real name rather than strangler.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.line: Don't use his real name. George Howard Scubb. It's a devil name.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Well I just wanted to say I'm doing it. [Toby leaves]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: He's doing it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [on phone] hey!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey, how'd the interview go?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh my gosh, wait until you. This guy was unbelievable. Ok so-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I can't wait to hear about it later. Do you want to come in at eight? And uh, don't eat because I'm ordering in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Eight? Really?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'll make it worth your while, I promise.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Sure. I mean, it's Philly. I can kill four hours. So uh, yeah. I'll see you at eight.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright, love you.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Love you.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: I'm here from BCI Marketing Consultants to meet with Andrew Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yes. The consultant. Andy said you can start right away so I will take you to your desk.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Ok, great. Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.line: Fresh meat! Fresh meat! [Making kissing noises]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Just keep walking, don't give her anything. She'll take it and run. I'm Erin by the way.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Nice to meet you. Cute sweater.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh, thanks. Your shoes match. I'm bad at small talk.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: I'm Kevin.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Pete?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Alice. Oh man.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: It's uh, been a while, huh?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: What, do you two know each other?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Yeah. We uh, have a history.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: History. Wow, ok. We dated for two years.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: That's so random.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Well. Is it?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Andy also hired a management consultant today. Oh no. [runs to front office]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: Hey Erin, look who's back. The bird man.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Hello beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Didn't you two used to do it?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: We absolutely did. Thank you for remembering that.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.line: She's looking good.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: Hi, I'm uh, Toby Flenderson. I'm here to see George Howard Scubb.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.line: This is the prison. Uh, I am not going in there with expectations, per say. Uh, I will meet George Howard Scubb. I will tell him that I believe he is innocent. I would understand if he felt motivated to hug me. I would understand if a friendship began. How did, how did Bogart put it? [imitating Humphrey Bogart] I think this is a start of my first friendship.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: So Pete was a librarian?

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: He worked as a librarian freshman year.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: Was he like the sexy librarian?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Is there like somebody who's in charge of marketing? Maybe I should sit near him or her.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hi, how's it going?

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Hi. [laughs] Good. I'd love to discuss strategy with you if you have a marketing p-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Wow this sure is intense. Having to share a workspace with someone you used to get it on with?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Andy, that is really inappropriate.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Awkward.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: It is awkward. This is a really uncomfortable situation that you've contrived.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: [high pitched] Really uncomfortable situation.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: It's alright Pete, you can handle it. I mean we all just gotta “move on”. Ain't that right professor lecture much? Uh, question. How's that medicine taste? Your own flavored? Is it just me or have these tables turned? Hmm. Hmm. [leaves]

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: So there's no marketing department.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: No.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: You know, times were tough. I was unemployed, I was still heart-broken over you, I've lost a good fifty pounds. But as you can see I put all that weight right back on. Feel how fat my buttocks are. Yeah, it's crazy. Touch it. It's like a warm pumpkin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: So Andy just called you up out of the blue?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Yeah. He told me you two broke up.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: You must be pretty horny. [Erin shakes head no]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.line: well, the good news is no more guilty conscience. At least you know he is the strangler. The proof is in the grip. Did they say when the vocal cords would heal? [Toby nods] One week? [Toby shakes head] Ok, two weeks? [Toby nods] Ok. You offered your neck in search of the truth. The proud neck of justice. Isn't that the expression? No. Well, anyway, it was, it was very brave. It really was quite brave.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: I feel like a show pony.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: And you look like one too. Thank you Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: You're welcome. Would you like some stew?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: By all means. And I will carve the roast skunk. Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Mmhm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Would you like the stink sack?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Is it any good?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: No, you don't eat it. It's a toy, like a wish bone. You know, prettiest girl gets the stink sack.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Thank you. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: So, when's the wedding?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Oh, um actually uh, we are just friends.

quotes.speaker: Shirley
quotes.line: That's what Mose said about his lady scarecrow and look what he did to that poor thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Hello?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Hey! Back here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, wow. Seriously? Oh my gosh, is that champagne?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Si, senor.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, Jim I should have told you I didn't get the job.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Oh man. I'm so sorry. Are you alright?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, yeah. I'm more than alright. There's just nothing to celebrate.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Are you kidding? We're in Philly. We're having dinner together. And this is just consolation champagne. It's from the part of France that immediately gave up to the Nazis. Here.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [laughs] You're very quick on your feet. I remember you. Funny.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Alright. So, tell me all about it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Ok. Well, gosh. Thank you for your help today. Your perspective was very useful. Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: It was not an unpleasant way to spend an afternoon. [They shake hands. Then kiss] Dwight, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Right. Not outside. The horseflies. You know what? My farm is only a few acres East of here. Or, we could use the slaughterhouse.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: No, Dwight. The Senator.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Leave him. He probably won't even notice that you're gone. Be with me, Monkey.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I can't be your monkey, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: I'm not talking about some frisky romp in the warehouse. We have wasted too much of our lives ignoring the fact that we belong together. The eighty or ninety years that I have left in this life...I want to spend with you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: I made a vow. I gave my word.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.line: Stand by your man. It's what I would want if you were mine.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.line: Good night, D.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: How are you doing? Is it really rough?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: It is so unpleasant. You?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Hey, love turds. Conference room, now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Thank you all for coming in. Just wanted to check in. How is everyone's day?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Honestly, it was a little weird.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Really? Hmm. That's interesting. Because Erin and Pete thought it wouldn't be weird at all. Why do you think it was weird, Gabe? Maybe because you and Erin used to be an item?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I still wear Erin's button-downs around the condo sometimes. So it feels to me like we're still in a relationship-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Gabe!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: ...a lot of the time.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: And Alice, uh, I understand you once dumped Pete, ouch.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Dude, it was an amicable break up Andy.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Ok, while we're rewriting history, you never had a drinking problem.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: It was college. That is what you do.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Yeah you're also supposed to go to classes, so there's that.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Hey, Andy, is this at all work related?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: We'll get to that. Gabe, did Erin ever tell you that she loves you?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: [laughs] Oh no no no no no no. She wouldn't even let me say it. It was adorable. She would plug her ears and scream her heat out.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Gabe, can you stop talking? Cause every word out of your mouth is like the squawk of an ugly pelican.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I got a tattoo for you.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I didn't ask you to get that Nike Swoosh. Nobody did! You did that for you!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Just do it. You were the it that I was just doing.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: So you're dating a secretary now? Moving up in the world, Pete.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: She's nice to me.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: How's that P.E. degree coming? That's what he wanted to be. His dream in college was to be a gym teacher.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Well, guess what? He could still be a gym teacher. In fact, we could all still be gym teachers, so, let's-

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I technically cannot. I don't have the lung capacity to blow a whistle.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Oh my god.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: What kind of music are you into, Peter?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Uh, I like all kinds of music, Gabe.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Really? All kinds? So you like songs of hate written by the white knights of the Ku Klux Klan?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: No!

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Erin, are you even hearing this?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: He didn't even say that.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: He is not a very sophisticated man, I mean he can't even use chopsticks, so. Do I need to say anything else?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Erin, I've been to Japan. I know how to use chopsticks so well. Come back. One night.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: Gabe, I don't-

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Give me one night with you...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: What is that supposed to mean?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I have shaved everything...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: I don't want you to shave everything.

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: I wasted two years of my life on you, you realize that right?!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: I just want to be real clear that chopsticks is not the measure of a man. [Erin and Gabe argue in background]

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: I am as smooth as a porpoise. {Erin argues]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.line: Why don't you say in the beginning: “This isn't really going that well”

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.line: Shove his sashimi!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.line: What do you-!

quotes.speaker: Alice
quotes.line: Because I had to wait- [all argue]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.line: Alright, yes. That is a legitimate question. Does making Erin and Pete feel bad make me feel better? [Erin & Gabe and Alice & Pete argue in background] Yeah. Yeah, it does.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: So, imagine like the real estate version of Michael Scott and that was this guy. He did half the interview as Ace Ventura.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Tell me about the cologne. How much?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Oh, uh, entire bottle. At least.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: You're definitely hoarding this by the way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Guess what poster he had on his wall?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Austin Powers.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: MmMm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Ferris Bueller.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: MmMm. You're getting colder.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: Not Night at the Roxbury.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: [laughs] No. The Odd Life of Timothy Green.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: I'm sorry, how did you think I was expected to guess that?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't know, but it's interesting right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: It's fascinating.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: He said he can't help but tear up when he looks at it. It's like right next to his desk. He must look at it twenty times a day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: That's amazing. Well, listen. You can't win 'em all, right?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Mmhm.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: So, next interview has to be better.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: What do you mean? Of course it will. You're amazing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: I know. It's just even if it was, a great boss and a great job, I just, I don't know, I don't know if I want, um, I don't know if I want this.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: [long pause] Huh. This is a little out of left field.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.line: Is it? I just, I liked our life in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.line: And I have started a business in Philadelphia. [Pam shrugs]

quotes.speaker: Oscar's Computer
quotes.line: My grandfather know. Mah Jong will be here to stay. Hobbies of the East continues in a moment.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: You could all be doing this, just saying.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I watch way too many ads online and I don't do enough situps. So I bought these. Now, every time an ad pops up online, I get 30 seconds of ab blasting. I call it Ads for Abs. Ironically, I learned about the boots from an ad online.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.line: Why can't you just do regular sit-ups?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: I'll tell you why. Because...the floor...is...disgusting. Yeah, my trainer said everybody fails working out, that's how you win. Alright [tries to pull himself up] Ok. Kevin? A little help buddy?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.line: Oh, why don't your famous stomachs help you now?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Can someone please help me?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.line: Ow, these teas are hot, can someone help me please? [Erin moves Oscar out of the way for Phyllis]

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.line: Just- People! I'm not going anywhere. Soon, my core will get strong again and when that happens I'll be able to- Head rush! Ah! Can someone please help me? [Kevin shuts door] I- Hey! I'm not going anywhere! I'll be right here! Oh that's not good. [Oscars computer reads: Coming this May: The Office: An American Workplace. Ten years in the making, a look at the lives and loves of an average American small business office.] Hey guys! I've got twenty bucks for anyone who will help me. Kevin, would you like a pizza?
